cause.description:
Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) is a progressive, fatal neurodegenerative disease that slowly robs the body of its ability to walk, speak, swallow and breathe.
Facts about ALS
- The life expectancy of an ALS patient averages two to five years from the time of diagnosis.
- Every 90 minutes a person is diagnosed with ALS, and every 90 minutes another person will lose his or her life from the disease.
- ALS can strike anyone.
1. Promote Awareness
2. Support cutting-edge research
3. Comfort families
cause.mission: Fighting on Every Front to Improve Living with ALS (TM)
cause.name: Defeat ALS (aka Lou Gehrig's Disease)
